newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Pasminco sees Elura shut up to 4 weeks.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Pasminco sees Elura shut up to 4 weeks.

text.p: Pasminco Ltd said on Friday that production from its Elura base metals mine in New South Wales would stop for up to four weeks while pillar damage was repaired.
Pasminco said on April 30 that it had halted production at the mine following pillar damage caused by blasting. It said then that assessment of the damage would take about two days.

The company said in Friday's statement that it had a remedial plan which would isolate the damaged area on Level 6 of the mine and introduce dry fill from the surface to the Level 6 stope. "The work is expected to take up to four weeks. Production will recommence when the work is completed," it said.
The Elura mine produced 104,404 tonnes of zinc concentrates and 67,842 tonnes of lead concentrates in the nine months to March 31.
